headline: HAS Q3 Earnings Backed by Solid Wizards of the Coast & Gaming Momentum
summary: Hasbro's third-quarter results surged on Wizards of the Coast and digital gaming strength, with Magic and D&D driving standout growth.

headline: Morning Movers: Tesla, IBM slipping following quarterly reports
summary: Stock futures were modestly lower as disappointing quarterly results from major tech names weighed on sentiment. Markets look set to open with a muted tone, reflecting a mix of elevated risk and uncertainty. Oil surged nearly 4% after the U.S. imposed fresh sanctions on Russia’s top oil companies, creating a shockwave across energy markets and raising inflation concerns. Concurrently, the dollar firmed against major currencies ahead of a delayed U.S. consumer-price report, while the yen weakened

headline: Is the market due for a correction despite strong earnings?
summary: US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) inch higher Thursday morning as major companies continue to report earnings, the latest being EV developer Tesla (TSLA), IBM (IBM), toymaker Hasbro (HAS), and streaming giant Netflix (NFLX). Great Hill Capital Chairman and Managing Member Thomas Hayes expands upon what he is seeing in the earnings landscape as the rest of the Magnificent Seven prepare to report quarterly results and whether equities could be due for a correction ahead of a year-end rally. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: The Weekly Closeout: Amazon hikes fulfillment fees and retailers list AI as a risk factor
summary: The e-commerce giant will increase fees for third-party sellers next year and a growing number of retailers are pointing to AI concerns in their 10-Ks.

headline: Mattel: Near-Term Risks Outshine The Positive Developments
summary: Mattel faces mixed near-term prospects with execution risks in the Dolls and Infant segments, relying on strong Q4 and licensing deals. See why MAT stock is a hold.

headline: Hasbro (HAS): Losses Worsen 46% Annually, High Valuation Raises Risk Ahead of Earnings Season
summary: Hasbro (HAS) remains unprofitable, with losses having worsened at a steep 46.1% annual rate over the past five years. While revenue is forecast to grow by 3.9% per year, which is meaningfully slower than the US market average, the company is on track to swing back to profitability within three years. Earnings are expected to expand by 24.87% annually, outpacing the broader market. See our full analysis for Hasbro. Next, we'll see how these headline numbers measure up against the key...

headline: HAS Q3 Deep Dive: MAGIC and Digital Drive Growth Amid Tariffs and Supply Chain Shifts
summary: Toy and entertainment company Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 8.3% year on year to $1.39 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.68 per share was 2.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
